KH.content: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra
KH.linkedContent: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra

KH.content: khōra so virginal it doesn’t even have the figure of a virgin anymore
KH.linkedContent: khōra so virginal it doesn’t even have the figure of a virgin anymore

GOD.content: tremble in fear of unpredictable, unforeseeable, the untouchability of the arrival (tremo, tromeō, tromos, tremendus), enigma of trembling and tears, what are they metaphors or figures for?
GOD.linkedContent: tremble in fear of unpredictable, unforeseeable, the untouchability of the arrival (tremo, tromeō, tromos, tremendus), enigma of trembling and tears, what are they metaphors or figures for?

R.content: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind
R.linkedContent: figure of renvoi (remission, sending off, deferral) is like differance, trace, it creates spacing, and brings autoimmune in line with aporia, double bind

GT.content: figure of circle essential to economics, gift must remain aneconomic
GT.linkedContent: figure of circle essential to economics, gift must remain aneconomic

GT.content: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case
GT.linkedContent: relation of gift to “present,” essential knot in interlace of this discourse [GT], in knot of Geflecht of which Heidegger says the circle is perhaps only one figure/particular case

GT.content: overrunning the frame, which fixes space & time given: identification of figures (even the figure of metonymy) supposes stable relations btwn part & whole
GT.linkedContent: overrunning the frame, which fixes space & time given: identification of figures (even the figure of metonymy) supposes stable relations btwn part & whole

FK.content: figures of radical evil not simply figures; the whole evil: always inventing a new evil
FK.linkedContent: figures of radical evil not simply figures; the whole evil: always inventing a new evil

FL.content: for Benjamin, iterability precludes great founders, initiators, lawmakers (or “great” poets for Heidegger), preserves law, thus police become figure of this iterability
FL.linkedContent: for Benjamin, iterability precludes great founders, initiators, lawmakers (or “great” poets for Heidegger), preserves law, thus police become figure of this iterability

FL.content: police, index of ghostly violence, exemplary figure, figures w/out limit, w/out face or figure, not simply in uniform, a formless (gestaltlos) violence, all-pervasive specter
FL.linkedContent: police, index of ghostly violence, exemplary figure, figures w/out limit, w/out face or figure, not simply in uniform, a formless (gestaltlos) violence, all-pervasive specter

AF.content: circumcision carries literal singularity into figurality
a document of an archive, leaves trace of incision right on skin [superficial, like literature] lips of a wound, pellicular superimposition [invagination & circumcision?]
AF.linkedContent: a document of an archive, leaves trace of incision right on skin [superficial, like literature] lips of a wound, pellicular superimposition [invagination & circumcision?]

AF.content: scholar repeats the father’s circumcision [Yerushalmi calling Freud back to his father’s faith], even if only by figure
AF.linkedContent: scholar repeats the father’s circumcision [Yerushalmi calling Freud back to his father’s faith], even if only by figure

AF.content: maternity, as constructed as paternity [the usual thought is: mother real/ father figural], Freud makes a mistake in thinking only paternity is uncertain
AF.linkedContent: maternity, as constructed as paternity [the usual thought is: mother real/ father figural], Freud makes a mistake in thinking only paternity is uncertain

SPOM.content: via Marx, more new erupts in revolutionary crisis, more “out of joint,” more one must convoke the old, inheritance borrows from “spirits of the past” > figurality as the figure of borrowing, borrowing speaks, question of credit, faith, fiduciary
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, more new erupts in revolutionary crisis, more “out of joint,” more one must convoke the old, inheritance borrows from “spirits of the past” > figurality as the figure of borrowing, borrowing speaks, question of credit, faith, fiduciary

SPOM.content: figure of ghost, hidden figure of all figures, no meta-rhetoric of the ghost
SPOM.linkedContent: figure of ghost, hidden figure of all figures, no meta-rhetoric of the ghost

SPOM.content: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language
SPOM.linkedContent: figures of death: differance of technical apparatus, iterability, non-uniqueness, prosthesis, synthetic image, simulacrum, all of which begins in language, before language

HERP.content: friend has no face, no figure, no sex, at a distance neither absolutely infinite, nor absolute proximity (null) of an ownness (propriété) [see p. 70]
HERP.linkedContent: friend has no face, no figure, no sex, at a distance neither absolutely infinite, nor absolute proximity (null) of an ownness (propriété) [see p. 70]

HERP.content: what is the topos of the friend? a figureless figurehead?
HERP.linkedContent: what is the topos of the friend? a figureless figurehead?

HASD.content: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems, “shields” against the many
HASD.linkedContent: in topolitology of secret, figures or places of rhetoric are also political stratagems, “shields” against the many

HASD.content: “sacred allegories [iera synthemata],” would be conventional rhetoric if not for divine light of God, would be “cheap simulacrums of the figureless”
HASD.linkedContent: “sacred allegories [iera synthemata],” would be conventional rhetoric if not for divine light of God, would be “cheap simulacrums of the figureless”

HASD.content: figurative spatialization of current sense of speech and writing > in space btwn current sense and the other, the current sense is only a figure
HASD.linkedContent: figurative spatialization of current sense of speech and writing > in space btwn current sense and the other, the current sense is only a figure

HASD.content: figuration and places (lieux-dits) of rhetoric, topos, constitute concern of apophatic procedures
HASD.linkedContent: figuration and places (lieux-dits) of rhetoric, topos, constitute concern of apophatic procedures

HASD.content: seal: figures the figuration of the unfigurable itself, seal as imprint displaces typography of khora > khora—makes copies of paradigm; seal—valid for entire text of creation
HASD.linkedContent: seal: figures the figuration of the unfigurable itself, seal as imprint displaces typography of khora > khora—makes copies of paradigm; seal—valid for entire text of creation

HASD.content: text of creation exists as typographic inscription of nonparticipation in participation
HASD.linkedContent: text of creation exists as typographic inscription of nonparticipation in participation

MPM.content: de Man’s epitaph, the prosopopoeia he addresses to us from an incineration all the more sublime for having no tomb [cremated?]—emblazoned spirit: figure of effacement, the effacement of visible figure in prosopopoeia
MPM.linkedContent: de Man’s epitaph, the prosopopoeia he addresses to us from an incineration all the more sublime for having no tomb [cremated?]—emblazoned spirit: figure of effacement, the effacement of visible figure in prosopopoeia

MPM.content: the sovereign, secret, ideal signature—the most giving: the one that knows how to efface itself
MPM.linkedContent: the sovereign, secret, ideal signature—the most giving: the one that knows how to efface itself

MPM.content: de Man: prosopon poiein, to confer a mask or face, “prosopopoeia is the trope of autobiography…by which one’s name…is made memorable as a face” > (dis)figuration
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: prosopon poiein, to confer a mask or face, “prosopopoeia is the trope of autobiography…by which one’s name…is made memorable as a face” > (dis)figuration

MPM.content: Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning”: interiorizing idealization—devouring the other—mimetic interiorization is not fictive, it’s the origin of fiction, of apocryphal figuration
MPM.linkedContent: Freud’s “normal” “work of mourning”: interiorizing idealization—devouring the other—mimetic interiorization is not fictive, it’s the origin of fiction, of apocryphal figuration

MPM.content: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures receive possibility from these paradoxical structures: 1) inclusion in set of a part greater than set 2) that which regulates our relation w/ other as other [not mourning in current sense], that the other is capable of dying (which is our “own” mortality too) conditions rhetoric of faithful memory, serves to seal an alliance & call us to an affirmation of the other

MPM.content: [Derrida identifies various contexts, figures, in which to describe the limits imposed on figures: Errinerung, then Psyche, now Mnemosyne—one day Paul de Man]
MPM.linkedContent: [Derrida identifies various contexts, figures, in which to describe the limits imposed on figures: Errinerung, then Psyche, now Mnemosyne—one day Paul de Man]

MPM.content: for de Man, memory of traces of a past never present, which always remain to come—from the future, this promise of resurrection of anterior past, is a formal element, place where fictions & figures are elaborated
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, memory of traces of a past never present, which always remain to come—from the future, this promise of resurrection of anterior past, is a formal element, place where fictions & figures are elaborated

MPM.content: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]
MPM.linkedContent: if a past does not exist, no more does death—only mourning, figures of death, we inscribe in every trace (otherwise called “survivals”)—because they outlast us, trying their luck, in advance, “in memory of” [see p. 87n inexistence of past/death not futility/illusion]

MPM.content: time, memory: nothing other than figure of the marks that efface anteriority of past, “memory of the present” marks itself > only memory can recognize differential “stamp,” mark, signature, that relates a present to presence itself
MPM.linkedContent: time, memory: nothing other than figure of the marks that efface anteriority of past, “memory of the present” marks itself > only memory can recognize differential “stamp,” mark, signature, that relates a present to presence itself

MPM.content: ghosts always pass quickly, infinite speed, presence w/out present that in coming back only haunts > the ghost, le re-venant, the survivor, figure or fiction, presence w/out presence, instant w/out duration, not nothing
MPM.linkedContent: ghosts always pass quickly, infinite speed, presence w/out present that in coming back only haunts > the ghost, le re-venant, the survivor, figure or fiction, presence w/out presence, instant w/out duration, not nothing

MPM.content: recognize in figure of phantom the working of what Kant & Heidegger assign to transcendental imagination, “fantastic” temporalizing schemes and powers of synthesis > Kant: an art hidden in depths of soul
MPM.linkedContent: recognize in figure of phantom the working of what Kant & Heidegger assign to transcendental imagination, “fantastic” temporalizing schemes and powers of synthesis > Kant: an art hidden in depths of soul

MPM.content: why there must be multiple figures
MPM.linkedContent: why there must be multiple figures

MPM.content: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other
MPM.linkedContent: all figures are ghostly figures, speak like phantoms and phantomize the text > never define trace or phantom w/out ironically/allegorically appealing from one to the other

MPM.content: inexistence of past & death not futility/illusion, their literal non-presence is also their fictive or figurative value
MPM.linkedContent: inexistence of past & death not futility/illusion, their literal non-presence is also their fictive or figurative value

MPM.content: “even if this memory of prefiguration were possible, we know that it would offer no ‘anteriority’ that was not fictive or figural; it could only 'suppress' or ‘forget’ it”
MPM.linkedContent: “even if this memory of prefiguration were possible, we know that it would offer no ‘anteriority’ that was not fictive or figural; it could only 'suppress' or ‘forget’ it”

MPM.content: de Man: promise is “metafigural”, an allegory of a figure “which relapses into the figure it deconstructs”
MPM.linkedContent: de Man: promise is “metafigural”, an allegory of a figure “which relapses into the figure it deconstructs”

MPM.content: Montaigne: “good memory is scriptural, it retains its figure” vs. writing, hypomnesia, marks engraved w/in memory as on paper
MPM.linkedContent: Montaigne: “good memory is scriptural, it retains its figure” vs. writing, hypomnesia, marks engraved w/in memory as on paper

MPM.content: about de Man, Derrida says, “figures of rationality are profiled and outlined in the madness of the aporetic”
MPM.linkedContent: about de Man, Derrida says, “figures of rationality are profiled and outlined in the madness of the aporetic”

MPM.content: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]
MPM.linkedContent: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]

A.content: paradox of aporia: multiple figures of aporia do not oppose figures to each other, “instead installs the haunting of the one in the other”
A.linkedContent: paradox of aporia: multiple figures of aporia do not oppose figures to each other, “instead installs the haunting of the one in the other”

A.content: border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)
A.linkedContent: border of absolute arrivant keeps one from discriminating btwn figures of arrivant > the dead, the revenant (the ghost, he or she that returns)

A.content: if death figures a line of thought, it’s because it takes figure, has a privileged form, crosses the line [re: Heiddegger’s attempt to think death beyond all figure]
A.linkedContent: if death figures a line of thought, it’s because it takes figure, has a privileged form, crosses the line [re: Heiddegger’s attempt to think death beyond all figure]

A.content: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)

VM.content: God’s face commands while hiding, more and less a face than all faces, face neither face of God nor figure of man but their resemblance, a resemblance thought w/out the Same
VM.linkedContent: God’s face commands while hiding, more and less a face than all faces, face neither face of God nor figure of man but their resemblance, a resemblance thought w/out the Same

PP.content: figure of the father is the figure of the good, capital, chief, good(s)
PP.linkedContent: figure of the father is the figure of the good, capital, chief, good(s)

PP.content: in the pharmaceutical enclosure, an artful living organization of figures, it is all about father/son, legitimacy of inheritance, sperm, no mother; as a living thing logos always issues from father, writing is weakened speech, ghost, living-dead, simulacrum (eidōlon), errant, pervert, outlaw, bad seed, adventurer, bum, doesn’t know identity, his name, father’s name
PP.linkedContent: in the pharmaceutical enclosure, an artful living organization of figures, it is all about father/son, legitimacy of inheritance, sperm, no mother; as a living thing logos always issues from father, writing is weakened speech, ghost, living-dead, simulacrum (eidōlon), errant, pervert, outlaw, bad seed, adventurer, bum, doesn’t know identity, his name, father’s name

PAS.content: the figure of the other, sans figure
Blanchot’s figures, room, sea, staircase, etc. are going to be effaced, figures san figure; not places in space, but they have a certain horizontality (thus the attribution of spatial horizon)
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s figures, room, sea, staircase, etc. are going to be effaced, figures san figure; not places in space, but they have a certain horizontality (thus the attribution of spatial horizon)

PAS.content: Blanchot: the figure’s disappearance, most human truth, truth closest to “me”
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: the figure’s disappearance, most human truth, truth closest to “me”

PAS.content: drowning (noyade) is not a simple figure to be dragged into abyss of this other word (parole)
PAS.linkedContent: drowning (noyade) is not a simple figure to be dragged into abyss of this other word (parole)

POOF.content: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility
POOF.linkedContent: philosophers of the future will be at once its [the fundamentally other] figure & responsibility

POOF.content: via Michelet, fraternity always caught up in vertiginous process (mechanics) of hyperbolization: from the strict literal (‘natural’ fraternity) to the figurative literal (universal, infinite fraternity) > thus, [strictly] woman ‘does not yet know how to read’ fraternity, she is not included in the idiom, the singularity; but, [literally] she is like [the promise of] absolute fraternity, ‘more just than just,’ law beyond law
POOF.linkedContent: via Michelet, fraternity always caught up in vertiginous process (mechanics) of hyperbolization: from the strict literal (‘natural’ fraternity) to the figurative literal (universal, infinite fraternity) > thus, [strictly] woman ‘does not yet know how to read’ fraternity, she is not included in the idiom, the singularity; but, [literally] she is like [the promise of] absolute fraternity, ‘more just than just,’ law beyond law

SH.content: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be circumcised opened like a door to “who” would come]
SH.linkedContent: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be circumcised opened like a door to “who” would come]

F.content: Wolf Man tries to kill all dead figures w/in him, thus they are still alive
F.linkedContent: Wolf Man tries to kill all dead figures w/in him, thus they are still alive

FWT.content: the coming of the one who or which comes doesn’t yet have a recognizable figure
FWT.linkedContent: the coming of the one who or which comes doesn’t yet have a recognizable figure

FWT.content: logic of exemplarity leads to an abyss (figurality undermines the entire question) [re: those w/ self-hatred resembling Jews]
FWT.linkedContent: logic of exemplarity leads to an abyss (figurality undermines the entire question) [re: those w/ self-hatred resembling Jews]

FWT.content: symbolic, spiritual [equivalence, re: justice]: figure of the unfigurable
FWT.linkedContent: symbolic, spiritual [equivalence, re: justice]: figure of the unfigurable

WM.content: metaphor of (the) usure (of metaphor): the ruining of figure; usure as erasure, rubbing out, and usure as increasing return in the form of revenue, surplus value, supplementary capital
WM.linkedContent: metaphor of (the) usure (of metaphor): the ruining of figure; usure as erasure, rubbing out, and usure as increasing return in the form of revenue, surplus value, supplementary capital

WM.content: metaphysics, supposedly, the history of the erasure of the sensory figure
WM.linkedContent: metaphysics, supposedly, the history of the erasure of the sensory figure

WM.content: acc. Polyphilos, philosophy puts transparent figure (not exactly a metaphor) of primitive meaning, of original (always sensuous and material), into circulation: metaphor is no longer noticed, and taken for proper meaning (first meaning, first displacement, are forgotten)
WM.linkedContent: acc. Polyphilos, philosophy puts transparent figure (not exactly a metaphor) of primitive meaning, of original (always sensuous and material), into circulation: metaphor is no longer noticed, and taken for proper meaning (first meaning, first displacement, are forgotten)

WM.content: to signify metaphorical process, coins have often been used, analogy w/in language described by analogy btwn language and something other than itself > but that which seems to figure [i.e. coins] cannot be contained w/in regional science, linguistics philology: opens a discourse on figuration itself
WM.linkedContent: to signify metaphorical process, coins have often been used, analogy w/in language described by analogy btwn language and something other than itself > but that which seems to figure [i.e. coins] cannot be contained w/in regional science, linguistics philology: opens a discourse on figuration itself

WM.content: classical conception of metaphor concerns itself with economy of moving from one figure to another, not w/ very production of figure
WM.linkedContent: classical conception of metaphor concerns itself with economy of moving from one figure to another, not w/ very production of figure

WM.content: for Aristotle, proper name is nonmetaphorical prime mover of metaphor, father of all figures > everything turns around it, towards it > metaphor as substitution of proper names w/ fixed meaning & referent
WM.linkedContent: for Aristotle, proper name is nonmetaphorical prime mover of metaphor, father of all figures > everything turns around it, towards it > metaphor as substitution of proper names w/ fixed meaning & referent

DS.content: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer
DS.linkedContent: hymen, one of those “beneficent figures” engendered by “the opposition btwn the closed and the open”: i.e. the fan, the book, the dancer

P.content: parergon stands out (se détache), not like work, which also stands out > parergon stands out against 2 grounds (fonds) [work, background], as that which merges (se fond), effaces itself; frame’s thickness as margin not figure—or figure that comes away of its own accord (s’enlève d’elle même)
P.linkedContent: parergon stands out (se détache), not like work, which also stands out > parergon stands out against 2 grounds (fonds) [work, background], as that which merges (se fond), effaces itself; frame’s thickness as margin not figure—or figure that comes away of its own accord (s’enlève d’elle même)

ROP.content: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & disseminal remaining, no longer belonging to economy of repression
ROP.linkedContent: Lacan uses trinitarian figures to give firm consistency to a resistance supérieurement organisée > letter always arrives; here proceeds division btwn 3 & 4, btwn resistance bound up in repression & disseminal remaining, no longer belonging to economy of repression

ROP.content: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)
ROP.linkedContent: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)

SP.content: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)
SP.linkedContent: what impresses mark of stylate spur in question of woman? this doesn’t concern la figure de la femme: question of figure open and closed by “woman” > concerns instead her abduction (s’enlever)

OTO.content: mother is the faceless figure of a figurant, an extra, gives rise to all figures by becoming anonymous, everything addresses/destines itself to her, she survives, as long she’s at bottom
OTO.linkedContent: mother is the faceless figure of a figurant, an extra, gives rise to all figures by becoming anonymous, everything addresses/destines itself to her, she survives, as long she’s at bottom

ATIA.content: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]
ATIA.linkedContent: transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]

ATIA.content: radical evil and double figure of animal: innocent or demonic, apocalyptic
ATIA.linkedContent: radical evil and double figure of animal: innocent or demonic, apocalyptic

ATIA.content: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)
ATIA.linkedContent: for Lacan, move from animal to human (to speech, to truth, to symbolic order): abyssal concept of a feined feint or pretended pretense (not merely the figure or simple feint)

ATIA.content: Nietzsche & Kafka realized better than anyone: Mother, Law, God, Animal > indissociable figures of the same Thing
ATIA.linkedContent: Nietzsche & Kafka realized better than anyone: Mother, Law, God, Animal > indissociable figures of the same Thing

DPi.content: DP will survive (other figures will be invented for it) > still must militate against it
DPi.linkedContent: DP will survive (other figures will be invented for it) > still must militate against it

REST.content: [re: les question de la démarche embarrassée (boîteuse ou louche?)] i.e. “Who is walking?” “On whose feet?” > idiomatic figures of questions seem necessary; “necessary: it’s an attribute,” still vague > better to say question-idioms the form of which is very fitting, clinging (collant) (tightly/flexibly) to figure or body of what you here wish to turn into an object (feet)
REST.linkedContent: [re: les question de la démarche embarrassée (boîteuse ou louche?)] i.e. “Who is walking?” “On whose feet?” > idiomatic figures of questions seem necessary; “necessary: it’s an attribute,” still vague > better to say question-idioms the form of which is very fitting, clinging (collant) (tightly/flexibly) to figure or body of what you here wish to turn into an object (feet)

REST.content: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)
REST.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, oppositional pairs as Überfall, injure the thing in the thing: hypokeimonon (underneath) or hypostasis/symbebekota (on top) [which becomes in Latin: subjectum (substantia)/accidens], aisthēton/noēton (sensible/intelligible), hylē/eidos-morphē (matter/form-figure)

REST.content: ask question of frame by way of figure/trajectory of lace: a stricture by alternate and reversible passage from inside to outside, under and over
REST.linkedContent: ask question of frame by way of figure/trajectory of lace: a stricture by alternate and reversible passage from inside to outside, under and over

REST.content: [re: Heidegger’s stance that a picture is useless to apprehend the useful] this reason doubles up (se dédouble): un mouvement d’entrelacement du lacet: 1) the interlacing of lace w/ itself 2) incompletely laced (entre-lacé), entrouvert (half-open) 3) figurer of lace interlaced with what is figured
REST.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s stance that a picture is useless to apprehend the useful] this reason doubles up (se dédouble): un mouvement d’entrelacement du lacet: 1) the interlacing of lace w/ itself 2) incompletely laced (entre-lacé), entrouvert (half-open) 3) figurer of lace interlaced with what is figured

REST.content: Heidegger’s argument hangs (tient) on 2 reasons that double each other, remarkable mode of interlacing: one reason marked in the other or in itself
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s argument hangs (tient) on 2 reasons that double each other, remarkable mode of interlacing: one reason marked in the other or in itself

DST.content: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures
DST.linkedContent: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures

DST.content: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure
DST.linkedContent: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)

DST.content: fidelity to the terrifying form, the ineluctable, that which lends itself to all figures and schemas; could there be fidelity w/out the faith called for in this dissymmetry?
DST.linkedContent: fidelity to the terrifying form, the ineluctable, that which lends itself to all figures and schemas; could there be fidelity w/out the faith called for in this dissymmetry?

DST.content: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)
DST.linkedContent: rhythm: spaced repetition of a percussion, inscriptive force (insensible) of a spacing > doesn’t belong to visible/audible figuration—still structures them (rhythmotypical, typorhythmic)

PIO.content: tout autre not any figures of ontotheological configuration (subject, consciousness, unconscious, self, man or woman)

TR.content: machine/event resembles a monster: there is no resemblance to a monster, so new figure of event-machine is no longer a figure [exemplary like woman]
TR.linkedContent: machine/event resembles a monster: there is no resemblance to a monster, so new figure of event-machine is no longer a figure [exemplary like woman]

TR.content: one always dealing w/ series of deconstructions: deconstruction of deconstruction of figures

TR.content: de Man: deconstruction of figural dimension threatens autobiographical subject
TR.linkedContent: de Man: deconstruction of figural dimension threatens autobiographical subject

TR.content: de Man: text as body (always retraceable to metaphor) displaced [deconstructed] by text as machine, in this process suffers loss of illusion of meaning [dis-figuration, de-metaphorization]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: text as body (always retraceable to metaphor) displaced [deconstructed] by text as machine, in this process suffers loss of illusion of meaning [dis-figuration, de-metaphorization]

IW.linkedContent: history’s harshest reality, its most murderous aspects—displacements of figures?

PSSS.content: Freud: “paternal nucleus” hidden behind every divine figure

PSSS.content: cruelty there will have been, cruelty before any personal figure, before “cruelty” is an attribute—no one’s fault

TN.content: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)
TN.linkedContent: can one figure an untouchable extension? difficult except for intelligible extension w/out body (Descartes, Kant) or insensible sensible (Hegel, Marx)

TN.content: Nancy’s 4 figures: 1) form of extension 2) fashioned 3) as trope 4) as visage (face)
TN.linkedContent: Nancy’s 4 figures: 1) form of extension 2) fashioned 3) as trope 4) as visage (face)

TN.content: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any “work of mourning”
TN.linkedContent: being unimaginable gives rise to phantasms, allegories, figures, metonymies: technics > no overcoming (surmonté) this mourning w/out mourning [of autobiography] by any “work of mourning”

TN.content: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, touching the limit > moment of decision

TN.content: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline
TN.linkedContent: philosophy, literally, has never touched anything > inversely, all one ever does is touch a limit (destiny of this figurality) [hymen]; to touch is to touch a limit, a surface, a border, an outline

TN.content: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss
TN.linkedContent: touch untouchable-touchable surface/border/limit on exposing edge of an abyss

TN.content: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it
TN.linkedContent: philosophy will have “touched” something 2x: limit & unfoundable abyss beneath/beyond it

TN.content: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure) p. 105 untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher
TN.linkedContent: there can only be a figure of touch, one only touches by way of figure > the object, the touchable thing, the "thing itself,” is the untouchable (gives itself, opens only in history of figure) p. 105 untouchable, the excess of inaccessible beyond, the origin of figural fiction: le toucher

TN.content: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit
TN.linkedContent: Derrida jokingly scolds himself for scolding Nancy: stop using this incredible vocabulary > abstain from ‘touching,’ ce concept sans répondant assuré: figures w/out figure, therefore w/out credit

TN.content: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?
TN.linkedContent: would figure of limit have to be tangible? isn’t the tangible the very contamination of the proper, of contamination itself, of contact/contagion/impurification?

TN.content: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure
TN.linkedContent: for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure

TN.content: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
TN.linkedContent: “transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism

TN.content: the 3 values of exemplarism [re: hand/touch]: 1) l’échantillon quelconque (random sample), indifferent 2) teleological value—best example 3) et surtout, un simulacre d’échantillon dont le symptôme trahirait une autre téléologie cachée: symptom of a metonymy, because touch always has been figural, some figural substitute courant sans fin to its “proper” abyss
TN.linkedContent: the 3 values of exemplarism [re: hand/touch]: 1) l’échantillon quelconque (random sample), indifferent 2) teleological value—best example 3) et surtout, un simulacre d’échantillon dont le symptôme trahirait une autre téléologie cachée: symptom of a metonymy, because touch always has been figural, some figural substitute courant sans fin to its “proper” abyss

TN.content: start from fire to think the touching of self-touching > not only fire but flames, since light means what is more than a figure: haptical light of self-consuming flames eludes worship, burns effigies spontaneously, “more than a figure,” the transfiguration of figurality
TN.linkedContent: start from fire to think the touching of self-touching > not only fire but flames, since light means what is more than a figure: haptical light of self-consuming flames eludes worship, burns effigies spontaneously, “more than a figure,” the transfiguration of figurality

TN.content: God’s hand not a figuration, the hand in the proper sense, the hand of salvation, le main de l’à-dieu (the God-ward goodbye hand)
TN.linkedContent: God’s hand not a figuration, the hand in the proper sense, the hand of salvation, le main de l’à-dieu (the God-ward goodbye hand)

TN.content: how to go from unfigurable to figurable (God to man’s hand) > question of passage, figural transfer—but one answer: passage, like Incarnation, Passion, Transubstantiation, mediation btwn infinite immediate & finite medium, btwn infinite & singular finite—is logos fashioned into flesh, the Son, the Hand of the Merciful Father [heterotautology]
TN.linkedContent: how to go from unfigurable to figurable (God to man’s hand) > question of passage, figural transfer—but one answer: passage, like Incarnation, Passion, Transubstantiation, mediation btwn infinite immediate & finite medium, btwn infinite & singular finite—is logos fashioned into flesh, the Son, the Hand of the Merciful Father [heterotautology]

TN.content: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
TN.linkedContent: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)

TN.content: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit
TN.linkedContent: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit

TN.content: eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour
TN.linkedContent: eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour

WOG.content: the ‘thoughts of difference’ Derrida shares in common w/ Deleuze & Foucault concern that which resists, like difference, analogy of a certain community/contemporaneity: figure or face of the mask, simulacrum or lure (leurre)—or whatever cannot be configured

WOG.content: the tout autre of the Greek, the figure of a tout autre unfigurable by him
WOG.linkedContent: the tout autre of the Greek, the figure of a tout autre unfigurable by him

LG.content: genre-clause (clause de genre): clin d’oeil, écluse (floodgate), clôture qui s’exclut de ce qu’elle inclut, déclasse ce qu’elle permet de classer > unfigurable figure of clusion, forme sans forme, neither sees day nor brings itself to light

LG.content: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]
LG.linkedContent: edge (bord), borderline (ligne de bordure), overflowing (débordement) do not arise w/out a fold—which figure of folding? [the answer: double chiasmatic invagination]

CIN.content: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle
CIN.linkedContent: cinder obviously a figure, but because word “cinder,” via the name, is supposed to name the thing (not the word), it names one thing in place of another, metonymy when cinder is separated, names one thing while figuring another from which il ne rest rien de figurable en elle

SPEC.content: usteron proteron, “preceding falsehood” of generations, when figure w/out figure, name w/out name, of the mother returns: this is the logic of obsequence (Glas) > la mère enterre tous les siens

CHOR.content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
CHOR.linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

CHOR.content: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
CHOR.linkedContent: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
